title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 171-1.3 - Resident grooming
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 171-1.3 - Resident grooming

State Regulations
(a) Consistent with the provisions of this Part, residents may wear their hair, and
facial hair, as they choose. (b) The length and style of residents' hair and facial hair may be restricted where
such restrictions are necessary to preserve the safety, security or good order
of the facility or the health of any individual. (c) Residents may be required to observe
reasonable precautions with respect to hair or facial hair in the interest of
health and safety. (d) Where the
involuntary removal of a resident's hair or facial hair is determined advisable
to preserve safety, security or good order of the facility or the health of any
individual, the facility director shall make a written request to the deputy
director for residential services, with a copy to the director of ombudsmen, stating the reasons necessitating such removal, and shall not proceed until
written approval of such action is received. Notes
